body.p: Agavi Routing is a generalized rule engine that maps foreign request formats (such as URLs or HTTP headers, for example) to Agavi Actions and their parameters. In Web context, Routing is responsible for parsing URLs and other parts of an HTTP request and generation of HTTP links.

URLs are an extremely important part of modern Web applications. A correctly organized URL structure improves search engine rankings, allows people to access parts of your website quickly, and enables the developers to expose application services and APIs to the outside world in a consistent and clear fashion.

In Agavi, Routing serves as a layer of indirection between your application and outside world. This means that the internal organization and structure of your application has no direct bearing on URLs and vice versa. Even though it is often convenient to structure your URLs a way that is similar to the internal layout of your Modules and Actions, it is absolutely not a requirement to do so.
